 Interesting. This is the "eveidence" I usaully don't get to see and hear.=
 All I usually hear is someone saying how every other researcher in the wor=
ld gets nothing, he is the only one that gets the valid communucation, whic=
h personally I find highly insulting. 
 
 One fact is, I did not make a "te=
lephone to dead", I don't know what the f--- that is, and I don't endorse i=
t! Nor do I appreciate my name being connected to the so called "Telephone =
to dead" on every friggin' ad for Moon's public appearances. I just make th=
e boxes, I'm not someone's lacky. 
 
 Frank-S


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com=
From: babiarz3@...: Mon, 3 Dec 2007 18:27:02 +0000Subject: [EVP-I=
TC] Re: Maybe there is only one box user allowed!?




Thank you for this p=
ost. it was an amazing life altering experiencefor all. --- In EVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups.com, lisby@... wrote:>> Frank--I have listened to this APSR broadca=
st and was incrediblyimpressed with what occurred at this event. Chris's bo=
x is quitecapable of behaving like John Edward--directly bringing relations=
through to talk to those who need to hear them. Some of the responseswere a=
stoundingly clear and loud. It certainly sounded similar to whatI have hear=
d of what Bruce is getting, and honestly, it is exactlywhat I hope to get w=
ith my box when I receive it.> > If you haven't listened to this, you reall=
y should. I think Chrismade his usual statements about Edison and the 30, b=
ut aside fromthat, this was a wonderful session and people were extremely m=
oved.> > If you want, I'll find the URL.> > Ann> > > > -----Original Messag=

s only one box user allowed!?> >> >> >"Christopher was immediately taken by=
 what he had seen and heard.He was able to > make a direct connection with =
spirits. inhabitants,victims, participants, and > witnesses...describing am=
azing events andeven some unspeakable acts that had > happened within the w=
alls ofthese notoriously haunted places. The details > afforded by thesespi=
rits gave answers to lingering questions that could not > have comefrom any=
one but the parties involved. Already amazed by the >instrument's ability t=
o connect with these historical figures,Christopher soon > realized that ot=
her entities were trying to reachout as well. Deceased fathers, > sons, mot=
hers, daughters, and friendsof session participants were sending > messages=
 through the device.Talk of this spread, and last year, at the Ghost > Chas=
er's WeekendConference in Savannah, Georgia, Christopher was asked to do a =
>presentation about his research with the Telephone to the Dead. Thisquickl=
y > turned into an impromtu public demonstration, withparticipants, one by =
one, > coming forward requesting to speak withloved ones who had died. Surp=
risingly, > even to Christopher, theserequests were met with comforting and=
 sometimes vital > messages. Thepresentation was recorded and broadcasted b=
y A.P.S.R. Radio."> > > > From a recent add for another presentation, but a=
pparently therest of us get nothing like this, so it doesn't even work for =
us.Guess I'll just go back to killing time wth Ham radio, and quitwasting a=
ll my time and money on useless boxes. > > > > Curious that no one else get=

researcher in the world gets nothing, he is the only one that gets the vali=

 <BR>
=
 One fact is, I did not make a "telephone to dead", I don't know =

being connected to the so called "Telephone to dead" on every friggin' ad f=
or Moon's public appearances. I just make the boxes, I'm not someone's lack=
